introSequence.text: So you're the one from Småstad. I heard you impressed Gunnar. That won't impress me.
Let me tell you about this town. Industristad was built on iron and sweat. The paper mill runs the economy, the union runs the mill, and everyone watches everyone.
The people here don't trust outsiders. Especially reporters. They've been burned before — Fabriksbladet writes whatever the mill tells them to.
This isn't a small-town paper anymore. Fabriksbladet has three full-time reporters and a photographer. We have you.
Same rules. Five days. Fall behind and you're out. I don't do second chances.

introSequence.text: You're from Industristad. Birgit says you can take a hit. We'll see.

Kuststad used to be a fishing town. Now the harbor runs on cargo ships and silence. Everyone here has something to hide — the captain, the coast guard, the shipping company. Especially the shipping company.
Sjöfartstidningen is bankrolled by the shipping conglomerate. They print press releases and call it journalism. The fishermen read us. The harbor workers read us. That's who we fight for.
The sea takes things here. Boats. People. Evidence. If you want to find the truth, you'll have to look where the water is deepest.
Five days. Same rules. I don't repeat myself.
